comments:
Build id: 200302060800
VM: Sun JDK 1.3.1
For more configuration details, please see the attached config.txt file.

I have started this bug in JDT-Debug land, but I believe it is likely that this
is an SWT bug.

I wanted to run an ant build.  I right-clicked on my build.xml file and selected
'Run Ant...'.  The dialog came up, and I clicked run.  Eclipse locked up.

The log file contained the following:

Config.txt, my full configuration details as obtain by Help->About Eclipse
Platform->Configuration Details
Sorry, dates on the .log file walkbacks indicate that they didn't happen today.

The exception in the image registry has been fixed - bug 26127.

The other problem is new - can you reproduce it?

I have not been able to reproduce this bug.

Notice in the full stack dump that there is no OS.WaitMessage this indicates to
me that the SWT thread died, but the resources did not get cleaned up.
I see nothing here that relates to the Ant integration.

I am going to mark this bug a duplicate of bug 31877. This bug doesn't have 
the distracting stack traces :-)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 31877 ***
